= Deployment Database =

== Overview ==

The original Deployment Database (DDB) is an MS-Access database which contains information about all deployments, instruments, personnel and sites for a specific location. Other specific-user database can be used if a [#Interface_requirements minimum interface requirements] are met.

In the toolbox, the `DDB/executeDDBQuery` function acts as a wrapper around the DDB, and returns query results as vectors of matlab structs. This means that no conversion between Java-Matlab types is necessary.

== MS-Access Schema ==

The complete MS-Access DDB schema is shown below:

http://imos-toolbox.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/ddb_schema.png

== Interface requirements ==

The following subsections detail the tables and fields which are used by the toolbox. 
 * All of these tables and fields must be present
 * Table and field names must be identical (case sensitive)
 * Field types must be identical/compatible

|| *Table Name* || *Field Name* || *Data Type* || *Description* || *Status* || *NetCDF default template* ||
||!FieldTrip||FieldTripID||Text||Field Trip ID - use AIMS Log Req Number||<font color="#FF0000">Mandatory</font>||||
||!FieldTrip||!FieldDescription||Memo||Descriptive text for field trip||<font color="#FF0000">Mandatory</font>||||
||!FieldTrip||!DateStart||Date/Time||Start date for field trip||<font color="#FF0000">Mandatory</font>||||
||!FieldTrip||!DateEnd||Date/Time||End date for field trip||<font color="#FF0000">Mandatory</font>||||
||!DeploymentData||!DeploymentId||Text||Code-generated unique ID||<font color="#FF0000">Mandatory</font>||||
||!DeploymentData||!EndFieldTrip||Text||Field Trip number||<font color="#FF0000">Mandatory</font>||||
||!DeploymentData||Site||Text||Use to link to sites data table (which contains lat and long)||<font color="#FF0000">Mandatory</font>||||
||!DeploymentData||InstrumentID||Text||Use to link to Instruments_Id in Instruments table (Instrument description)||<font color="#FF0000">Mandatory</font>||||
||!DeploymentData||!FileName||Text||Catalogue number/Sample number/File name - should ideally be a unique identifier||<font color="#FF0000">Mandatory</font>||||

||!DeploymentData||!TimeFirstGoodData||Date/Time||Time of first good data||<font color="#FF0000">Mandatory</font>||||
||!DeploymentData||!TimeLastGoodData||Date/Time||Time of last good data||<font color="#FF0000">Mandatory</font>||||

||Instruments||InstrumentID||Text||Unique ID for instrument||<font color="#FF0000">Mandatory</font>||||
